intro: Epilobium densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower willowherb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along stream banks and in wet meadows. Epilobium densiflorum is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
